title: Why are school clubs such a big deal in Japanese culture? - Quora

response.answer_text: Because in 90% of the time, that's the only social interraction students get with people outside their class. Japanese students start school at 8 o'clock, usually finishes at 16 o'clock, then they either go home and study, or go to their club, actually have a social life, untill about 18 o'clock, and then go home and study. It's basically the only time not spent eating, sleeping or studying for the poor bastards, and the schools know that, which is why most schools encourage club activities

Is that a phenomenon only in Japan?The current Japanese education system was created by studying in Germany and the United Kingdom.Probably, We also learned from the developed countries that club activities aimed at improving position.I don’t think that Japan alone is thinking about education and club activities with its own philosophy. What is seen as a problem?　I'd like start thinking about it if you tell me.
